Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel with Cheapskate Wifi”
Reviews.Author: lianamagee
Reviews.Content: In today's world, having wifi is pretty critical for the business traveler, as well as for regular folks who want or need to keep in touch. If you stay at this hotel, plan on paying ridiculous prices, OR try to jam everything into their "free" 10 minuets "per 24 hour period" OR go next door and steal wifi from the Ramada. To me, this is crazy. Just stay at the Ramada. In addition, there were no vents in the bathroom, the shower curtain hems were lovely shade of gold (from mold), the beds we're too hard and the breakfast was miserably boring. Also, our room was on the front so it was very, very noisy at night with traffic on Bayswater. On the plus side, the lotion was great for our purposes, near the Tube, our room was comfortable for 2 of us, our room had a small balcony which was cute and the staff was willing to accommodate our request to arrive one day early. I won't go back tho... The whole deal with the wifi and the stupid rule on 10 minutes every "24 hours" was too stupid for me. Next time I'll just go to the Ramada, where they happily give you wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would not recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: TheWalkers9113
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for a lovely stay at the Westland as it was recommended by Rick Steves. The email exchange to book a room was very friendly as well. There was not a lot of rooms available and the last email exchange had us booked in as a double for the first night, a single (we would flip a coin to see who was on the floor) and then finally a double room for the last two nights in London. I asked that we be put on a waiting list for a double room the night we had to move to a single bed and we were informed that we were at the top of the list. Yeah we thought. When we arrived at the hotel the reception was very friendly and efficient. We were informed that they had good news - we would not have to change rooms after all. We were thankful for that. What a disappointment though when we saw our room. It was very spacious with two double beds and a single but was very shabby. I could handle shabby though at 156 sterling a night (or so we thought) it seemed that the room should be better appointed. What I could not put up with was what looked like mold in the bathroom vent (see picture). I wiped down a grease mark on the wall in the bathroom and the towell was black with soot. We informed the reception of the cleanliness issue and they said they would alert housekeeping. They did clean around the vent while we were out but that was it. We decided that night that there must be healthier and less shabby accommodation to be had. We found the Best Western Phoenix around the corner on a much quieter street for only 130 sterling a night. We gave the Westland notice and put up with our second night there. What a surprise at check out to learn that they were charging us for a three bedroom room at the rate of 169 sterling minus the Rick Steeves 10% discount. In my mind it is only good service to advise customers when upgrading a room at check in that they will be paying more than what was last quoted or the hotel should give a complimentary upgrade. I think we would have been able to swallow the additional cost if the room had been remotely decent. As it was we paid the higher bill and advised the two owners who were there at check out that the room needed serious attention and they should check it out personally. The response was "we have given a note to housekeeping" I would have expected more from a family run business. Our stay at the Phoenix was delightful. A clean, well decorated and quiet room. If you have to venture into the Westland you had better double confirm the rate and see the room before committing. I would hope that there are well kept rooms in this hotel... I have included pictures of the wrinkles in the carpet, the threadbare bedcover, peeling paint and mildew/mold?. I will say that the breakfast was good and the gals in the breakfast room were delightful - genuinely friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “No hot showers, Wi-Fi expensive, breakfast very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: JohnHS1
Reviews.Content: We suffered 2 days without hot showers, with hotel staff making excuses about the hotel being full. Wi-Fi only available through expensive plans, we had to sit on the balcony and scam the free Wi-Fi from the hotel next door. They moved us to another room and we finally had hot water. No AC, so it was quite muggy a couple nights. Breakfast was uninspired, the sausage was especially bad, although the drip coffee was very good. This hotel whas recommended by Rick Steve's, but he should reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hotel, there is better out there.”
Reviews.Author: OliviaB19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June for 1 night on a business trip. The room was dirty, as was my colleagues, and the bathroom was dreadful. The toliet seat was broken and dirt had gotten into the crack, it was gross. The bedding, thankfully, appeared clean. Breakfast was good, and all cooked to order. I wouldn't stay here again, as there are better hotels out there for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -- Disappointing Room”
Reviews.Author: Car0Sel
Reviews.Content: From the other reviews it looks like it is hit or miss with this hotel. The location is excellent -- right across from Hyde Park and Kensington Palace and very close to the tube. Our welcome was cool, wi fi cost extra and the continental breakfast only included tea/coffee, juice, toast and jam. Our room was clean but in poor condition with stains all over the carpet, faded bedding, light fixtures falling off the wall and drawer handles that came off when you opened the drawer. A rolled up mattress remained in the hallway on the floor outside our room for the entire stay. The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff varied a great deal. We booked well in advance of our stay but the hotel charged us a fee for changing our reservation even though they had several weeks notice.

Reviews.Title: “Open all night!”
Reviews.Author: jmj1096
Reviews.Content: We arrived Thursady night very late, after roaming around for 45 minutes TRYING to locate the hotel I had booked and finding it locked up tight for the night! The staff at the Westland were very understanding and nice and found us a room for that night and the next two nights! The English Breakfast that came with the room was absolutely delicious! The staff was kind and inquiring about our day each time we came into the hotel, they even posted our post cards for us!

Reviews.Title: “Rick steve was right! Great recommendations!”
Reviews.Author: gmlw1950
Reviews.Content: The family-run hotel owners were friendly & helpful. We were fortunate to have an up-graded room located downstairs --- very quiet! The size of the room was adequate. The location was in good proximity to the underground tubes, The Nottinghill neighborhood & Portobello Road. Breakfast service was excellent. I would not mind coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Well, Not good, Not that bad.”
Reviews.Author: ReggieW80
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a Deluxe Twin Room @155pounds/night, the room is spacious, well-a-quite-old-fashion, yellowish everywhere may be it just the decor, the clearness is OK, has to say a bit wear-out every bit. the TV is good though. Breakfast is OK, Staff are nice, but I left a big laundry bag to receipt for same day laundry, they returned to me at evening untouched and say the staff forget to take it to laundry company. (come on, the bag is big and it is in reception!). I am fine with it as the staff sincerely expressed sorry about it in the end

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sahara07
Reviews.Content: Me and my family have been travelling a lot but we have never seen such a dirty rooms with an .old-fashionated and breaked furniture as in this hotel .Towels were changed everyday but they were smelling badly as if they were not clean.The so called''continental breakfast'' contained only bread and butter and jam and the orange juice was missing on the third day!The only good thing we can say about this hotel is his location .Although we were really disappointed with our arrival we spent a lovely time in this amazing town!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - first class room and service”
Reviews.Author: UKApollo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westland Hotel in November 2010 for a 3 night stay in London. Over the years we have stayed in many hotels, and this is one of the few which we found faultless. The premier room was spacious, clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful, full English breakfast everything a breakfast should be, location for a London break ideal (a maximum of 15 minutes to the West End by tube or taxi), and good value for money. This will be our chosen hotel when we vist London in future, without a doubt. I understand the same family have run the Westland for over 50 years, and no wonder they are still successful.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: lisylou_10
Reviews.Content: We booked a couple of days away after getting married, upon our arrival at the hotel we were greeted with a happy pleasant greeting, showed to our room, which was all lovely. First impressions were good, until we had a closer look- the room was a nice size for what we booked( premier double) but was under the impression of a separate seating area as i read when booking the room, only to find a sofa, 2 chairs & a coffee table in the same room, this wasn't a huge problem, the cleanliness in the bathroom was awful, all around the bath was black, and inside the bath was actually black, the shower was nice but was impossible to stand underneath to shower as you had to hold the shower head, as there was nowhere to put it, my husband had to stand outside the bath holding the shower head so i was able to wash, was not impressed at all. When booking for our room, we were under the impression that our room would have a view of Kensington Palace, this was not the case, we actually had a view of the Russian Embassy, this wouldn't have bothered us in the slightest, but if its there in black & white then you expect it ! I agree with another review i read about the hotel rooms needing a refurb, they do look a bit dated, On the day we were leaving we went down for breakfast, the restaurant was cold, the staff seemed quite pleasant, that was until we ordered coffee, and we told to go & fetch it ourselves, when it came to ordering breakfast, i ordered egg, sausage, bacon & tomato, my husband ordered a full English breakfast, although when it arrived we actually had exactly the same on our plate????? Was not very nice, on the menu it said soft eggs will only be cooked on request of guests, however when ours arrived they were practically raw on top, overall i would say that this is an average hotel, nothing more. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More space for the money”
Reviews.Author: jkl2000
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at this hotel. Originally we were booked in a Standard Triple room (we were two adults, one child, and a baby). We found the room a little small, though that was partly due to the fact that there were three single beds and a crib, which all took up a lot of floor space. They told us they could push two of the single beds together, but instead we opted to switch to a Deluxe room which I think was a triple, but when I originally booked it didn't seem to be available. The best thing to do is to book over the phone and tell them your needs and wants and they should be able to tell you what type of room is best. We found the Standard room a bit shoddy (in a cozy way!), but the Deluxe room was much nicer and larger, or at least better arranged, and not all that much more expensive. The Standard room had a small balcony overlooking Bayswater Road, while the Deluxe room had no balcony but overlooked the preferable side of the hotel (trees and a little bit of a view of the hotel next door). The Deluxe room was quiter, though the room facing Bayswater wasn't overly noisy. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful, and the breakfast was very good. We had it delivered to the room most mornings, and they only charge a small fee for that. The location is great if you like to be able to get into Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park easily, as we did. Being right on the Central tube line is also very convenient of course. The one thing the hotel could do that would really improve the rooms is to add smal refrigerators to the rooms. We kept some milk and yogurt for the baby in the fridge behind the counter in the lobby, and they were very nice about fetching it for us whenever we needed it, but a small fridge in the room would have helped a lot. Also, the pillow are very hard - that can be improved too. But I don't believe you'll find a larger room than this (#106) for the same price in London, and it was nice to avoid the chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellant location”
Reviews.Author: Jerry047
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights in June at this hotel. A single delux room. Paid $144. Canadian per night for 6 nights (7th night free) included breckfast of cereal,toast,pot of tea,and juices. Single room on 5th floor was private,clean,and quite.Bed was comfortable. No air conditioning but opened windows in both the room and bath and had no trouble sleeping. Room was made up each day and restocked with tea,coffee, milk,and sugar. Tv reception varied at times as a result of a lose cable connection. Staff was very helpful and friendly throughout my stay.Location was excellent with 2 subway stops within a 5 minute walk in either direction from the hotel. Kensngston Park is almost opposite the hotel. Enjoyed the various ethnic foods in the area. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel indeed”
Reviews.Author: LeedsPensioner
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. Staff very helpful - nothing too much trouble. Very comfortable beds - rooms and bathroom spotless - breakfast excellent. Very good location for over 60`s as buses to very many locations outside the hotel door - gave the bus pass a lot of use! Also - if coming via Kings Cross station - bus outside hotel takes you directly to the station. Had a lovely break - will certainly go again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: eleanola
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in July, located halfway between Notting Hill Gate and Queensway tube stations. The reception staff were all very pleasant and friendly. Lovely reception lounge, though we never sat in it. Room 116, twin bedroom on 3rd floor, with a window to the side of the building. Decent sized room, for London. Washstand in the bedroom, with just a bath and a toilet in the en suite. Hair/ body gel dispenser on the wall (though not very foamy), and nice towels changed daily. Tea cups and kettle in a drawer, but no tea, etc. Trouser press, always a bonus. Quite a few restaurants just along the road, or alternatively, after a fairly long, but very pleasant walk, to Kensington High St., there is a huge choice of restaurants and shops there. Nice firm beds, and choice of 2 pillows. Hot weather, and no A/C, but we slept OK with the window open. Surprisingly, no curtains on a small window by washstand or another internal window, but tired enough for light not to bother us. Breakfast adequate: buffet of juice, cereal and coffee. Freshly cooked dishes, tea and toast to be ordered from a waitress. I can recommend the sausages, but not the coffee. We enjoyed our stay, and might stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fromupnorthLeeds
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night - the room was clean, comfortable, and quiet, the breakfast was freshly cooked, and the staff were nice and helpful Very good location for public transport, Hyde Park, and there are several restaurants nearby. The only drawback was that there was nowhere to store luggage securely if you wanted to check out and return later for your luggage. However, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: baad_14
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Westland for our first trip to London, and we LOVED it! The location is wonderful, as there are 3 tube stations within walking distance! Hyde Park is directly across the street, and it makes for a great view. Bayswater road is busy, but we are city girls, and didn't even notice the noise! The breakfast is small, but sufficient. And for dinner there is multiple places around that are great! Bella Italia was one of our favorites. The staff at the Westland was phenominal! They held our luggage when we arrived at 7am, and let us freshen up before we left the hotel. They were also quite helpful for any questions we had about the area, and London in general. And an overall nice attitude. We would reccomend this hotel to anyone who needs a place to stay in London that is in a good location and looking for a decent price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: AndyMM44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westland for a week celebrating my daughter's high school graduation. The location is great, very close to two tube stations, with a bus stop in front of the building, so getting around is so easy. Lots of things in walking distance. We loved: the Swan Pub; Cafe Diana; Pret A Manger. Hyde Park is across the street: great for strolling, picnics, Kensington. Walk to Portobello Road market on the weekend. It is fabulous! People, food, antiques, new and used clothing, so vibrant and alive. The hotel staff are very nice and accommodating. We had two rooms in the back, next to each other, and shared a balcony. Very quiet. Loved the church bells tolling. Our only complaint was with the car the hotel called to take us to the airport: we were assured that the fee was 50 and not to tip the driver. Upon reaching the airport, the driver asked for 53. I notified the hotel that the service may have changed their rates, or that the driver had changed the rate in order to get a tip. They responded promptly that they would check into the matter. I don't have a problem giving tips, but if I am told not to tip, I won't. All in all, a great stay at the Westland. It is on a busy street, so don't get a room in the front if you want quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but...”
Reviews.Author: CanadianGoesAbroad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westland twice on a trip to England. On the outside and in the lobby, it is beautiful. But one must keep in mind how old it is. It is cosy, but cramped. Both my rooms were singles, with a 2.5 foot bed. The shower head in one room was broken. The decor and furnishings really need to be upgraded, but if you are in the mood, it does add to the air of the hotel. Other than the rooms, it is a beautiful place. Most of the staff were helpful, especially with directions. Beware though, it is not "directly" accross the street from Kensington Palace. As well, the restaurant only serves breakfast. It is in a great location, but the building is a behind a tall brick wall, so if you have never been there before and neither has your cab driver, you may have a little trouble finding it. It was fine for my first trip to London, but next time I think I'll check out the Ramada Hyde Park.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away !”
Reviews.Author: phclement92150
Reviews.Content: I confirm some of the previous comments : I do not recommend at all this hotel. Rooms were not clean, small rooms, noisy location f you are on Baywater's road. I've got a small room, one window without any curtain... It's quite expensive for thsi level of quality, including an average breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice people, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: regazzamilano
Reviews.Content: the staff and location are great. unfortunately, i think the hotel is in need of updates. there is no water pressure in some of the rooms. my family stayed in 5 different rooms and 3/5 had working showers. my husband and i had to shower in our family's rooms since our shower was just trickling. biiiig problem the hotel gave us free wireless internet in exchange for the problem. still, it would've been nice to have a good shower. full english breakfast included. nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: Liam1982
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was helpful.Nice room,in tipical "English Style",beatiful view on Kensington Gardes,near Hyde Park.Two tube near the hotel (Quennsway and Bayswater).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Waterdipper
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westland was a wonderfully pleasant surprise. Our luggage, left a few days early, was waiting in our room when we arrived late in the evening. Our room was large, comfortable, and clean. The staff were pleasant and also informative and helpful when needed, but not intrusive. They saved us quite a bit of strain, as well as cost by arranging for a private car to take us back to Heathrow at 5 a.m. The cost was only slightly more than it would have been to go by tube and Heathrow Express, but with much less lifting and carrying of luggage. Breakfast was very nice - hot, fresh, tasty - we thought it more than adequate - and served by an attentive and friendly young woman. The location is very convenient to two tube stations, Portobello Market (as featured in the movie "Notting Hill"), Kensington Palace, and Hyde Park. We had no sense of apprehension while walking around the area, although we weren't out past about 00:30. All in all we had a very nice stay and would not hesitate to recommend the Westland.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: yoido
Reviews.Content: Perfect location: great access to various tube lines. The staff was very helpful and engaging. The full English breakfast was authentic and very filling. The rooms and baths were larger than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: texastwosome22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Westland. Location was great, easy access to the tube and bus (weather and traffic made bus usage frustrating; tube much better). Staff was very helpful and made calls for us (on their own, not requested) to confirm open and closing times of the sights to see. Also, arranged for taxi. Hotel has an elevator (lift) which makes checking in/out much easier. Room was clean and very functional. Breakfasts were good; food service staff was attentive and efficient. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: berescga
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to London I wanted to stay in a hotel that had old world charm, and was in a good location. The Westland had both. The room was much larger than we expected, and the bathroom was great. Both were kept very clean. The hotel is small & family run, so it had the charm I was looking for, and there were 3 tube stops within a 5 minute walk. We couldn't have asked for better. We felt the price was reasonable as well. The staff was friendly and helpful. We arrived 3 hours before check in, and had planned just to drop off our luggage, but they had a double room that was not being used, and let us have that room, which was much more than we expected. We only had two problems. I felt the pillow was extremely hard (so we went to Ikea & bought a new one), and the free breakfast only included toast, which wasn't that big of deal, but it would have been nice if it was a little more substantial. Our stay was 6 nights Sept/Oct 2007. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ishmayel
Reviews.Content: Excellent value. We stayed 3 nights in early October. Great location in residential area on Bayswater Rd., across street from Kensington Gardens. Within 10 minute walk of 3 tube stations. Plenty of restaurants within a few minutes walk, and a laundry one block away. Our room, with balcony, faced Kensington Gardens, and was very quiet with large double-pane door/window. The room was large, by European standards, and very clean. The en-suite bathroom was also large, had combo bath/shower with plenty of towels, pressure and hot water. There is a bit of confusion in the breakfast room about full-English. If your room rate includes it, be sure to tell the staff. The continental breakfast is very basic. The reception staff was very helpful, with suggestions on transportation, eating, ATMs, etc. The manager, Shirley, was very helpful in getting us a refund on some long distance calls made from the room using an independent provider. Be aware! Would stay again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “These hoteliers were our saviours after a real bad experience...”
Reviews.Author: CazzaScotland
Reviews.Content: The kind people from the Westland Hotel took us in when we had nowhere to go after walking out of another filthy hovel of a hotel called the Blue Bell in Notting Hill. It was 5pm on a Saturday night in London with nowhere to stay but when we knocked on their door, a warm welcome awaited us when they heard our plight. The owners really put themselves out - they did not actually have a room for us, but offered us the flat on the top floor for 1 night, then said they could provide a proper bedroom for the next 2 nights. We gladly took them up on their offer. We found the hotel very comfortable and clean, the reception staff extremely kind and helpful - they go that extra mile to make your stay a pleasant one and make you welcome! Really lovely hot breakfast - all freshly cooked to order! Piping hot, which is the only way! Very peaceful, relaxing experience, after a most horrendous fright when we were shown the accommodation at the hotel we had originally booked. We walked out of a nightmare into a haven of friendliness and helpfulness and felt at home during our stay. Thank you all very much.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the spacious,solid rooms, but there are some problems”
Reviews.Author: jwmpet
Reviews.Content: We visited the Westland hotel from 21 â€“ 24 August 2007. It is just what you expect from an old English hotel: a large lobby, well decorated in an â€œold-fashionedâ€� style and very kind staff. We booked a single and a double room. The former was a rather small room at the rear of the hotel, the latter was a spacious room on the 5th floor with a wide view on Kensington Gardens. Westland is situated on the very busy Bayswater road, but the double glazed windows tempered the traffic noise, although this will probably not be sufficient on the first three floors. There are several bus stops in front of the hotel and the underground is about 300 meters away. This means that there is a direct connection with the city centre and the Royal Albert Hall as well (bus 70). There is a very nice bar, the Black Lions, near the corner of Bayswater Road and Queensway, where you can have a good meal and nice wine at reasonable prices. The Bar Churchill Arms is worth the visit too (take the bus in the direction of the Albert Hall). There are several good restaurants in the neighbourhood. There is no air-conditioning, so during warm periods it might be rather unpleasant, certainly if you let the street noise prevent you from opening a window. This wasnâ€™t our problem at all, as the weather was rather rainy. The rooms are carpeted and well decorated and have a trouser press, an ironing board, a desk, a linen cupboard, a TV (only 5 channels) + radio and coffee/tea facilities (but without the usual coffee- or teabags). Our beds had very good mattresses and blankets that smelled a little dusty (which was no problem after I beat my blankets after the first night). There is a large bathroom with a hair dryer, a tub and a shower, but showering is a problem. In the single room it was impossible to take a shower in the morning: if the tap is coming above point 3 on a 10 points scale, there is no hot water. In the double room the water pressure varies from a small jet to normal. In this bathroom the ventilator works night and day, and you cannot switch it off. We informed the staff, but no action was taken. Continental breakfast was included in the price of the room and consisted of juice, toasted bread, butter, jam/marmalade and tea or coffee. For an additional 8 pounds (about 12 euro) it is possible of having a full English breakfast. Then you can also have cornflakes, eggs, bacon, sausage and porridge or kippers or baked beans or cheese and hot chocolate. For this price, I have had better breakfasts. We booked through Buro Britan in Amsterdam and paid 525,00 euro for both rooms, which is really a good offer. Will we return at that price? Probably yes, but only when we can have a room far from Bayswater road.

Reviews.Title: “Very large rooms for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Greenlady56
Reviews.Content: The Westland Hotel offers very large rooms for a reasonable price by London standards. The hotel is well situated near the northwest corner of Kensington Park and is close to 2 Circle line tube stops. The front desk staff is very helpful and there are plenty of good restaurants nearby. Rooms are kept quite clean though the decor is not fancy (we had a standard room) but who cares about room decor as you're there to see London! The shower is strong and has plenty of hot water excpet in the early morning hours. Unlike many other places we stayed in England there is actually a large tub in the spacious bathroom if you prefer baths to showers. English breakfast is included in the price of the room and it's quite good with fast service if you're in a hurry to get our sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “elegant old world charm”
Reviews.Author: saysull55
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Westland for 5 nights in June. We loved it! Old world elegance, beautiful large room with a little balcony, nice large bathroom. Very clean. Elevator. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the desk is staffed 24 hours. We had a queen size bed, a little hard, but we got used to it.. The location was fabulous. 5 minute walk to 2 tube stops, right on a bus line, a walk to Queensway, Notting Hill, Portobello market, restaurants, a laundramat. Right near Kensingston Gardens. There was no AC but you could request a fan and ice. The breakfast was kind of boring. More than one Starbucks nearby! We felt that it was the perfect location, and a very comfortable place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Westland Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 154 Bayswater Road | Bayswater, Westminster, London W2 4HP, England
